name: plangency
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality or fact of expressing sadness, especially with a deep, low sound: There is a plangency in her voice that suits a tragic role. I love the plangency that the oboe brings to this song.
More examplesFewer examplesThroughout the piece, the strings never lose their sweetness and plangency.I greatly admired the dignity and plangency that the leading lady brought to the role of Tosca.The music has a certain grandeur as well as a bleak plangency.The conductor succeeds wonderfully in expressing the plangency of the piece.
